metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24806 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow and out of bounds memory access

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1').
